para.text: Many of the data in the Farm Process in MODFLOW-OWHM version 2 can be specified as either lists or arrays and can be either static or transient. Some of the data have key words that must be specified. The data may also have scale factors applied or be specified in an external file generated outside of ModelMuse. The data may also have an associated externally generated SFAC file that modifies the data before it is used by MODFLOW-OWHM. These various choices are presented in a table on each Farm Process pane except the
pane. The tables are all similar.

li.text: The first column has the description of the input data.
The "Frequency" or "Use" column is used to activate a particular option and to specify whether it is inactive, static, or transient.

The "Array or List" column is used to specify whether a particular option is specified as an array or as a list. The cells in this column are only active if the user has a choice about whether the data will be specified in an array or a list. If the user chooses "Array", a corresponding
will be created. The values of the data sets can be specified in the
dialog box. If the user chooses "List", the data are specified in one of the Farm Process dialog boxes such as the
The "Key Word" column, if present, is used to specify key words for data that require a key word to be selected.
The "Unit conversion scale factor" column, can be used to specify scale factors for data for which scale factors can be used
The "Externally generated file" column can be used to specify an input file for the data. The user is responsible for creating the file.
The "Externally generated SFAC file" column can be used to specify an SFAC file to be used with the data. The user is responsible for creating the file.

para.text: For more information about scale factor files and SFAC files, see the MODFLOW-OWHM documentation.
